content.description: Scramble up 4th class terrain to grassy ledge. Climb through easy terrain staying left of the bulge and exiting through the big V shaped crack formation. This is a good warm up climb and good for teaching trad climbing.
content.protection: Tons of cam/nut placements on route as well as top for TR.

content.description: Fun climb.  Lots of crimps and thin ledges to start.  Nice big jugs higher up.  Footing is tougher - hard to smear due to the rock being so weathered and smooth.  Good route to throw in some finger and fist jams, heel hooks and the like. You can also climb to the roof area, traverse left and play around on the roof. It's a fun one to top out on.
content.protection: Good trees at the top for anchoring topropes.  They are a good distance from the edge, so bring long gear.
content.location: Route is at Faints Roof area.  Toss ropes over the roof, go down and around the trail to the left and back right to reach the belay area.  Start to the right of the roof.  Climb through overhangs to the right of the roof, up the face to the trees and finish on roof.

content.description: The most obvious jug haul out the roof. Plug and go!
content.protection: the roof protects with a 1,.75,and 1 more .75

content.description:
Shorter route but good for a warm-up.  Start up a level from the main Faint's Roof area, just across from Ounce of Perception.  Mostly blocky hands and feet up to a small roof with a concave bow in it.  Pull through the bow to the top.   

  Start variation:  could be started as a boulder problem in the small "cave" to make the route more fun.
content.protection: Top Rope, can sling boulders or trees at the top, usually with static line.
content.location: Hike down as to the Faint's Roof area, start of climb is up a level from the main Faint's roof area on the climber's right wall.

content.description:
Easy 5th class moves up to the white face about 15 feet off the ground, then trend slightly right and top out at right end of overhang.   

  Good practice for beginning trad leaders.
content.protection: Standard rack. Good protection, but watch out for loose rock after the white face.
content.location: Immediately right of the ledges at the far right side (south end) of Faint's Roof area. Start at a short left (NW) facing corner with an oak tree.

content.description:
Alternate start to Blood and Pus. Begin ~5 ft further left in the shallow corner. Easy climbing straight up to the roof, then kick things up a notch as you traverse along the base of the roof to meet up with Blood and Pus. Get to good holds in the black rock, pull one or two more moves, then enjoy the romp to the top. 

  Note on the grade: the guidebook gives this thing a 9, but it was distinctly harder than The Dragon or Faint's Roof the way I climbed it. I may have gone a couple moves higher before traversing than the book describes, but the sequence felt very natural and really fun.
content.protection: Standard rack, a small cam or two (.2 X4, plus or minus a size) to protect the traverse.
content.location: Right side of the blocky face that forms the start of Faint's Roof, just left of Blood and Pus

content.description: 10' left of Faints Roof. Start at tree. Climb up easy blocky section. Stay right of the water mark, go slightly left through notched overhang.
content.protection: Trees and wide range of gear placement for top-rope. Most on-route gear placements are horizontal so it's good for cams and hexes.

content.description: Start on Right Side of Faint's Roof area at vertical streaks in rock. Follow streaks up to the large imposing roof and pull at crack.
content.location: Right side of Faint's Roof area, just left of Ounce of Perception.

climbs.name: Anticipation of a New Lover's Arrival

content.description: Climb the center of the easy face through a bulge, then move through roof on great horizontals from left to right, finishing at the peak of overhanging prow.
content.protection: Cams from 0.4-4. Long slings for anchors or fingertip pro to build an anchor right on the last prow.
content.location: Starts 4 ft left of In Your Face

content.description: The top of the Faint's Roof area is the large, main overlook at the end of the access trail running from the AT to Annapolis Rock.  It is the second formation with the large roof south of Argo Rock.  The climb Faint's Roof (5.10a) is an area favorite.
